channel.title: Can't Jar my Client
channel.description:
Okay so i am able to play with my client via Eclipse through java path, client, but when i try to jar it using JarMaker, and set the manifest - mainloader to Client, it does not appear to work.
Add me on skype if your willing to help: Melilshaw3

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Blackmemo Blackmemo
item.description:
@Blackmemo wrote:

Not really sure if help is still needed but…
Why didn’t you just JAR it using eclipse?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:22, topic:552792”]I’m at work and cannot use either for > 5 hours.

Your input directory should simply be the location of all of your .class files.

Your manifest Main-Class is the location of your main class, which according to your run.bat, is src.Client, meaning Client.class in the src folder.[/quote]

yea, but it doesnt work

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’m at work and cannot use either for > 5 hours.

Your input directory should simply be the location of all of your .class files.

Your manifest Main-Class is the location of your main class, which according to your run.bat, is src.Client, meaning Client.class in the src folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

Chassy13:

Your problem is with your directories, either your input directory or your manifest Main-Class directory. I can’t really distinguish which without seeing the client packaging.

do you have teamviewr and skype?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client

item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:18, topic:552792”]Try setting the manifest to src.Client

Also to save time you don’t need to sign it every time until you’ve got it working.[/quote]

Dont work

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Try setting the manifest Main-Class to src.Client

Also to save time you don’t need to sign it every time until you’ve got it working.

Read full topic

item.description:

Chassy13:

1-Output file is to the Desktop
2-Input dir. is to where the client.class is located
3-I set the Manifest to Client
4- i create the jar
5-then i sign it

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:14, topic:552792”]You need to make sure you are telling JARMaker that Client is in the src folder.

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_51\bin\java.exe” -Xmx512m src.Client 30 0 highmem members 32[/quote]

I am

item.description:

You need to make sure you are telling JARMaker that Client is in the src folder.

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_51\bin\java.exe” -Xmx512m src.Client 30 0 highmem members 32

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

Chassy13:

What’s inside run.bat?

@echo off
Title Client Console
cd bin
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_51\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m src.Client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:8, topic:552792”]So that’s the problem, Client either cannot be found or it cannot be loaded as the main class.

Make sure that Client is your main class. If you are 100% sure, then it’s a location issue.[/quote]

You think you could add me on skype(melilshaw3) i am a bit confused

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

So that’s the problem, Client either cannot be found or it cannot be loaded as the main class.

Make sure that Client is your main class. If you are 100% sure, then it’s a location issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:6, topic:552792”]The batch file is used for debugging the JAR, you should be seeing some type of error output as to why the JAR is not executing correctly - exactly the same concept as running a client using a batch file.

At the bottom of JARMaker, there is a checkbox option to generate a batch file. Make sure that is checked. Wherever you set JARMaker to generate your JAR, it will also generate a batch file to run the JAR, but with debugging.[/quote]

It says could not find or load main class Client

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

The batch file is used for debugging the JAR, you should be seeing some type of error output as to why the JAR is not executing correctly - exactly the same concept as running a client using a batch file.

At the bottom of JARMaker, there is a checkbox option to generate a batch file. Make sure that is checked. Wherever you set JARMaker to generate your JAR, it will also generate a batch file to run the JAR, but with debugging.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

Chassy13:

Okay, then make sure that is your main class. Are you getting errors anywhere? Open the JAR using the batch file that JARMaker generates.

The thing is that the client does not even open

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Shaw Pure Shaw
item.description:
@Pure_Shaw wrote:

Chassy13:

Make sure that if the java path points to the main class ‘client’, you are also setting it to ‘client’ in JAR Maker and not ‘Client’ - it is case-sensitive.

Yea but my client.java is with a capital c, so its like Client.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Jar my Client
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Make sure that if the java path points to the main class ‘client’, you are also setting it to ‘client’ in JAR Maker and not ‘Client’ - it is case-sensitive.
